title: How to Make a Jello Salad

steps.headline: Pour the water into a large bowl.

steps.description: This is listed as a serving size for 8 people. Stir for 2 minutes until fully dissolved.

text: Boil 1.5 cups (355 ml) of water in a pan over the stove.  Place an 8 oz. (226.7 g) package of cream cheese on the counter to soften. Pour the water into a large bowl.  Mix in 1 package of lime Jello or generic gelatin. This is listed as a serving size for 8 people. Stir for 2 minutes until fully dissolved. Stir in 1 8 oz. (226.7 g) can of crushed pineapple with the juice. Mix until combined. Place the large bowl in the refrigerator and allow it to set for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Remove it once it is syrupy, like unbeaten egg whites. Whip 1 cup (237 ml) of whipping cream in a mixer or by hand. Stop when the consistency reaches soft peaks. You can substitute the whipping cream with pre-packaged whipped cream. Combine the softened package of cream cheese with 1 cup (230 g) of cottage cheese in another large bowl. Fold the cream cheese in with a large spoon or spatula and stir until the cheeses are well mixed. Fold the freshly beaten whipped cream into the cheese mixture until very well combined.  Combine the partially set Jello with the cream and cheese mixture with a wire whisk.  Fold in 1/2 cup (58 g) of walnuts, or another nut of your choice.  Fold in 1 cup (50 g) of miniature marshmallows.  Spray a non-stick gelatin mold with cooking spray. The mold should be able to hold at least 6 cups (1.4 l), and it can come in a variety of shapes. Pour the salad into the mold. If you do not have a Jello mold, you can use a large bowl. Refrigerate until firm, approximately 4 hours.  Remove from the refrigerator.  Dip the mold in warm water for 5 seconds and then invert it onto a serving platter.  Garnish with fruit and serve your Jello dessert. If you have not used a mold, serve in the bowl, or mix it up again to loosen all of the ingredients. Finished.
sentences: Boil 1.5 cups (355 ml) of water in a pan over the stove.
Place an 8 oz.
(226.7 g) package of cream cheese on the counter to soften.
Pour the water into a large bowl.
Mix in 1 package of lime Jello or generic gelatin.
This is listed as a serving size for 8 people.
Stir for 2 minutes until fully dissolved.
Stir in 1 8 oz.
(226.7 g) can of crushed pineapple with the juice.
Mix until combined.
Place the large bowl in the refrigerator and allow it to set for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
Remove it once it is syrupy, like unbeaten egg whites.
Whip 1 cup (237 ml) of whipping cream in a mixer or by hand.
Stop when the consistency reaches soft peaks.
You can substitute the whipping cream with pre-packaged whipped cream.
Combine the softened package of cream cheese with 1 cup (230 g) of cottage cheese in another large bowl.
Fold the cream cheese in with a large spoon or spatula and stir until the cheeses are well mixed.
Fold the freshly beaten whipped cream into the cheese mixture until very well combined.
Combine the partially set Jello with the cream and cheese mixture with a wire whisk.
Fold in 1/2 cup (58 g) of walnuts, or another nut of your choice.
Fold in 1 cup (50 g) of miniature marshmallows.
Spray a non-stick gelatin mold with cooking spray.
The mold should be able to hold at least 6 cups (1.4 l), and it can come in a variety of shapes.
Pour the salad into the mold.
If you do not have a Jello mold, you can use a large bowl.
Refrigerate until firm, approximately 4 hours.
Remove from the refrigerator.
Dip the mold in warm water for 5 seconds and then invert it onto a serving platter.
Garnish with fruit and serve your Jello dessert.
If you have not used a mold, serve in the bowl, or mix it up again to loosen all of the ingredients.
Finished.
